# 图像入门

## 目标

在本次会议中:

* 在这里，你将学习如何读取图像、如何显示图像以及如何将其保存起来
* 你要学习这些函数：

)、cv.imwrite()
* 另外，你将学习如何用Matplotlib来显示图像。
该图片的可能在工作目录或者是绝对路径

* *   [cv.IMREAD_COLOR](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#gga61d9b0126a3e57d9277ac48327799c80af660544735200cbe942eea09232eb822 "If set, always convert image to the 3 channel BGR color image. ") : Loads a color image. Any transparency of image will be neglected. It is the default flag.
*   [cv.IMREAD_GRAYSCALE](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#gga61d9b0126a3e57d9277ac48327799c80ae29981cfc153d3b0cef5c0daeedd2125 "If set, always convert image to the single channel grayscale image (codec internal conversion)...") : Loads image in grayscale mode
*   [cv.IMREAD_UNCHANGED](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#gga61d9b0126a3e57d9277ac48327799c80aeddd67043ed0df14f9d9a4e66d2b0708 "If set, return the loaded image as is (with alpha channel, otherwise it gets cropped). ") : Loads image as such including alpha channel
Any transparency of image will be neglected
Loads image as such including alpha channel

Note

Instead of these three flags, you can simply pass integers 1, 0 or -1 respectively.

import numpy as np

import cv2 as cv

# Load an color image in grayscale

img = [cv.imread](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#ga288b8b3da0892bd651fce07b3bbd3a56)('messi5.jpg',0)
# Load an color image in grayscale
# Load an color image in grayscale

img = [cv.imread](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#ga288b8b3da0892bd651fce07b3bbd3a56)('messi5.jpg',0)

即使图像路径错误，它也不会抛出任何错误，但是打印img会给你None
A screenshot of the window will look like this (in Fedora-Gnome machine):
A screenshot of the window will look like this (in Fedora-Gnome machine):

**[cv.waitKey()](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ga5628525ad33f52eab17feebcfba38bd7 "Waits for a pressed key. ")** is a keyboard binding function. Its argument is the time in milliseconds. The function waits for specified milliseconds for any keyboard event. If you press any key in that time, the program continues. If **0** is passed, it waits indefinitely for a key stroke. It can also be set to detect specific key strokes like, if key a is pressed etc which we will discuss below.

is a keyboard binding function. Its argument is the time in milliseconds. The function waits for specified milliseconds for any keyboard event. If you press any key in that time, the program continues. If **0** is passed, it waits indefinitely for a key stroke.
It can also be set to detect specific key strokes like, if key a is pressed etc which we will discuss below.
毫米 为任何键盘事件等待指定的时间

**[cv.destroyAllWindows()](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ga6b7fc1c1a8960438156912027b38f481 "Destroys all of the HighGUI windows. ")** simply destroys all the windows we created. If you want to destroy any specific window, use the function **[cv.destroyWindow()](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ga851ccdd6961022d1d5b4c4f255dbab34 "Destroys the specified window. ")**where you pass the exact window name as the argument.
simply destroys all the windows we created. If you want to destroy any specific window, use the function
where you pass the exact window name as the argument.
这里你要传递正确的窗口名作为参数。

There is a special case where you can already create a window and load image to it later. In that case, you can specify whether window is resizable or not. It is done with the function **[cv.namedWindow()](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ga5afdf8410934fd099df85c75b2e0888b "Creates a window. ")**. By default, the flag is [cv.WINDOW_AUTOSIZE](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ggabf7d2c5625bc59ac130287f925557ac3acf621ace7a54954cbac01df27e47228f "the user cannot resize the window, the size is constrainted by the image displayed. "). But if you specify flag to be [cv.WINDOW_NORMAL](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ggabf7d2c5625bc59ac130287f925557ac3a29e45c5af696f73ce5e153601e5ca0f1 "the user can resize the window (no constraint) / also use to switch a fullscreen window to a normal s..."), you can resize window. It will be helpful when image is too large in dimension and adding track bar to windows.
There is a special case where you can already create a window and load image to it later. In that case, you can specify whether window is resizable or not.
It is done with the function
It will be helpful when image is too large in dimension and adding track bar to windows.

看下面的代码
```python
import numpy as np
import cv2 as cv
# 用灰度模式加载图像
img = cv.imread('messi5.jpg', 0)
```

import numpy as np
import cv2 as

Use the function **[cv.imwrite()](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#gabbc7ef1aa2edfaa87772f1202d67e0ce "Saves an image to a specified file. ")** to save an image.

First argument is the file name, second argument is the image you want to save.

[cv.imwrite](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#gabbc7ef1aa2edfaa87772f1202d67e0ce)('messigray.png',img)

This will save the image in PNG format in the working directory.
First argument is the file name, second argument is the image you want to save.
This will save the image in PNG format in the working directory.
Below program loads an image in grayscale, displays it, save the image if you press 's' and exit, or simply exit without saving if you press ESC key.
Below program loads an image in grayscale, displays it, save the image if you press 's' and exit, or simply exit without saving if you press ESC key.

import numpy as np

import cv2 as cv

img = [cv.imread](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#ga288b8b3da0892bd651fce07b3bbd3a56)('messi5.jpg',0)

[cv.imshow](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/df/d24/group__highgui__opengl.html#gaae7e90aa3415c68dba22a5ff2cefc25d)('image',img)

k = [cv.waitKey](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ga5628525ad33f52eab17feebcfba38bd7)(0)

if k == 27: # wait for ESC key to exit

[cv.destroyAllWindows](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ga6b7fc1c1a8960438156912027b38f481)()

elif k == ord('s'): # wait for 's' key to save and exit

[cv.imwrite](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#gabbc7ef1aa2edfaa87772f1202d67e0ce)('messigray.png',img)

[cv.destroyAllWindows](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d7/dfc/group__highgui.html#ga6b7fc1c1a8960438156912027b38f481)()
wait for 's' key to save and exit
wait for ESC key to exit
If you are using a 64-bit machine, you will have to modify `k = cv.waitKey(0)` line as follows : `k = cv.waitKey(0) & 0xFF`
If you are using a 64-bit machine, you will have to modify `k = cv.waitKey(0)` line as follows : `k = cv.waitKey(0) & 0xFF`

Matplotlib is a plotting library for Python which gives you wide variety of plotting methods. You will see them in coming articles. Here, you will learn how to display image with Matplotlib. You can zoom images, save it etc using Matplotlib.

Matplotlib is a plotting library for Python which gives you wide variety of plotting methods. You will see them in coming articles. Here, you will learn how to display image with Matplotlib. You can zoom images, save it etc using Matplotlib.

import numpy as np

import cv2 as cv

from matplotlib import pyplot as plt

img = [cv.imread](https://docs.opencv.org/4.0.0/d4/da8/group__imgcodecs.html#ga288b8b3da0892bd651fce07b3bbd3a56)('messi5.jpg',0)

plt.imshow(img, cmap = 'gray', interpolation = 'bicubic')

plt.xticks([]), plt.yticks([]) # to hide tick values on X and Y axis

plt.show()
to hide tick values on X and Y axis
A screen-shot of the window will look like this :
：A screen-shot of the window will look like this :
Plenty of plotting options are available in Matplotlib. Please refer to Matplotlib docs for more details. Some, we will see on the way.
Plenty of plotting options are available in Matplotlib. Please refer to Matplotlib docs for more details. Some, we will see on the way.

Color image loaded by OpenCV is in BGR mode. But Matplotlib displays in RGB mode. So color images will not be displayed correctly in Matplotlib if image is read with OpenCV. Please see the exercises for more details.
就可能不会被正常显示

Color image loaded by OpenCV is in BGR mode. But Matplotlib displays in RGB mode. So color images will not be displayed correctly in Matplotlib if image is read with OpenCV. Please see the exercises for more details.
1.  There is some problem when you try to load color image in OpenCV and display it in Matplotlib. Read [this discussion](http://stackoverflow.com/a/15074748/1134940) and understand it.
